title: Madras High Court had already upheld T.N. govt’s right to fix time, age and monetary limit for online games: Home Secretary
content: Counter affidavit filed in response to a batch of new writ petitions filed by online gaming companies challenging the TNOGA regulations

title: Preliminary exam for KAS posts: State Administrative Tribunal directs KPSC to refer unexamined questions to expert panel
content: The Tribunal said that the variation in translation would not be a ground for re-examination and interference with examination already conducted

title: Karnataka High Court orders handing over of custody of 16-year-old boy to parents from grandmother and paternal aunts
content: Acting on the ‘principle of best interest of the child’, the Bench pointed out that the dispute between boy’s parents and aunts had a detrimental effect on the minor child

title: 13 Bangladeshi nationals deported to their country, Centre tells Supreme Court
content: The verification process for the remaining illegal immigrants in detention centres in Assam is underway, says govt.

title: M.B Patil proposes land near BIAL for mega jewellery park
content: Despite global challenges like geopolitical uncertainties and tariff issues, India’s gem and jewellery sector has shown remarkable resilience, says GJEPC

title: Reconsider move to introduce CBSE in Maharashtra, says Supriya Sule
content: Ms. Sule questioned the implementation of the CBSE pattern, which ignores the existing education system in Maharashtra

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman Dhankhar speaks on judicial accountability, reminds MPs of NJAC Bill
content: Supreme Court clarifies Delhi HC judge judge transfer not linked to fire incident; Opposition raises concerns in Rajya Sabha

title: Nagarjuna Sagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve has 76 tigers, says annual report
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan releases the Annual Report and also unveils logo of Nagaravanams on the occasion of International Day of Forests

title: National Defence College team in A.P. for study tour
content: The team met with A.P. Chief Secretary and discussed the welfare programmes, Swarnandhra 2047 Vision Plan, and recently launched WhatsApp governance

title: Normal operations resume at NMDC as protesting workers return to work
content: NMDC resumes operations after worker protests, shares rise by 1.47% on BSE, aiming for 45 million tonnes production in FY25

title: PM’s Nagpur visit looms as police prioritise restoring normalcy in RSS hub; 99 arrested, 13 cases booked
content: Security deployed for Friday prayers; Central, State officers working to restore normalcy before PM’s March 30 visit; CM spends Friday night in Nagpur; city court remands 17 more people to police custody for “serious” charges

title: A.P. to fill 948 anganwadi posts, boost to womens’ employment
content: The move aims to strengthen child welfare and boost job opportunities for women across 26 districts in the State.

title: Manipur is peaceful, dialogue between Kuki and Meitei communities initiated: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said he sincerely hoped that through dialogue the distance and division between the Kuki-Zo and the Meitei community would be bridged in the near future

title: Indian Navy carries out critical medical evacuation of merchant vessel crew off Goa
content: Two naval ships and a helicopter were involved in evacuating three crew members with severe burn injuries from the vessel, 230 nautical miles west of Goa; one more crew member died before the rescue

title: NCP factions withdraw complaints against Rajya Sabha members
content: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar said based on the stand taken by leaders of both parties, he felt that it was “expedient to give quietness to both the petitions”

title: There is progress on GM food crops, says DBT
content: DBT official’s remark comes amid apprehensions over the Environment Ministry’s approval for commercial cultivation of GM mustard in 2022; Supreme Court is scheduled to hear petitions next month

title: Chhattisgarh government announces special incentives for ‘Maoism free’ Panchayats
content: Under the scheme, a panchayat would have to facilitate the surrender of every resident of its constituent villages who had been involved in the activities

title: Wages in four tea gardens in north Bengal being delayed, admits Centre
content: Wages delayed in north Bengal tea gardens, protests over land allocation for tourism, highlighting laborers’ plight and demands

title: LaunchPad 2025: ‘Dare to Disrupt’ summit begins at BITS Pilani Hyderabad
content: BITS Pilani Hyderabad kicks off LaunchPad 2025, a 3-day summit fostering entrepreneurship with startups, investors, and industry leaders

title: Lok Sabha approves Demand for Grants for various Ministries
content: Opposition MPs slam Govt for police action against protesting farmers in Punjab; Agriculture Minister hits back by saying Congress and AAP were “walking arm-in-arm” during Lok Sabha elections

title: Amid accusations, Veena George hints at failed plan to meet Nadda in Delhi on ASHAs agitation
content: Ms. George holds discussions with Cuban delegation in Delhi on March 20. She said that she tried to meet Mr. Nadda as she had assured the ASHAs on March 19

title: Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate the new AKG Centre on April 23
content: The new CPI(M)] State headquarters will be a nine-storey high-rise with offices and a press conference hall

title: AAIB to investigate all IndiGo tail strikes
content: There have been at least six known incidents of tail strikes involving A321 Neo planes in two years; AAIB to examine training and procedural lapses

title: Unseasonal rains leave mango growers worried over their crop prospects, hailstorms hit parts of north Telangana
content: Untimely rains coupled with gusty winds hit parts of Dharmapuri, Dharmaram, Thimmapur and various other mandals in the former undivided Karimnagar district

title: BJP accuses Congress of doing ‘contract jihad’ in Karnataka
content: BJP MP and national spokesperson Sambit Patra alleged that the Congress was using appeasement in a bid to achieve its political ambitions and it was creating a division in the country.

title: In push for made-in-India browser, a mandate to trust government encryption
content: Zoho, which won the Centre’s ₹1 crore browser challenge, must use an Indian root certificate, which major browsers have not trusted since a 2014 security breach; will achieve Indian Internet resilience, says IT Secy

title: Bee attack at the Thiruvananthapuram Collectorate sparks safety concerns and ecological debate
content: Forest officials voice concerns about the ecological impact of destroying the natural ecosystems of honey bees that play a vital role as pollinators. The situation has also cast a spotlight on the inadequate maintenance of public office premises and highlights the need for regular upkeep and pre-emptive measures to avoid a repeat.

title: Thrissur to host mega job fair under Vijnana Keralam project on April 26
content: Core objective of project is to generate employment opportunities for educated youth by enhancing their skill sets according to the demands of the job market

title: Father and three sons among five held in murder of TDP leader’s father in Kurnool
content: Murder the result of a long-standing rivalry between two families and the deceased was the father of the 30th Division Corporator, says Kurnool SP

title: Govt. redesigning master plan for development of Vizag: Minister
content: The Visakhapatnam vision document and master plan for the next 30 years will be released in four months, says P. Narayana

title: Alleged drug trafficking: action sought against unregistered wayside shops in Kozhikode
content: Police urged to conduct inspections in suspected shops reportedly frequented by drug pushers to expand their network

title: A.P. government to resolve all pending land issues in 3 months
content: The administration is focused on streamlining land-related processes, particularly concerning webland, freehold house sites, and small group allocations, CCLA said

title: Healthy orders from BHEL lifts the pall of gloom over ancillary units in Tiruchi
content: BHEL Tiruchi has received orders worth several hundreds of crores of rupees for boilers, industrial valves, tubes, and engineering items for various power plants

title: Draft Bill to rein in educational consultancies to be tabled in next session, says Minister
content: Draft Bill is framed based on the recommendation of a three-member committee constituted by the KSHEC, chaired by Digital University Kerala Vice-Chancellor

title: Rajasthan sets target for planting 10 crore trees with emphasis on water conservation
content: The State government would also shortly bring the first agroforestry policy and launch the “one district, one species” programme to promote a land use system integrating trees with crops and livestock

title: Civil society organisations call on govt. to stop gutting of RTI Act
content: The RTI Act’s qualified exemption on providing personal information is on track to become a blanket prohibition, alarming activists, who have called on the government to reverse course

title: Oji India opens their fifth plant in India at Sri City
content: The new automated plant in Sri City spanning 43,000 square metre is also touted to be the largest unit producing corrugated boxes and packaging accessories in South Asia

title: Cricket stadium’s name in Visakhapatnam is intact, says ACA president Sivanath
content: International Cricket Council Chairman Jay Shah has responded positively to the proposal of building an international cricket stadium in Amaravati, he says

title: Kumbakonam station redevelopment work to commence by June-end: Southern Railway GM
content: R.N. Singh says bidding process will begin soon for the ₹100-crore project and work is expected to be completed December 2027; he conducts speed trial test between Ponmalai and Villupuram

title: Revenue dept. completes proceedings to resume encroached land at Chokramudi
content: The departmental action is the culmination of the struggle of the natives of Bison Valley panchayat in the valley area of the Chokramudi hills, who formed an action council, Chokramudi Protection Council, seeking protection of the hills

title: Three stabbed as student groups clash at Perinthalmanna
content: Three Class X students arrested, admitted to observation home at Tavanur. Student who stabbed his schoolmates was under suspension

title: Bellatrix Aerospace ties up with Astroscale Japan for debris removal and sustainable orbit mobility
content: The collaboration aims to drive active debris removal, satellite servicing, and sustainable in-orbit mobility, contributing to a cleaner and safer space environment

title: Group-I Mains exam: APPSC gives one more chance to change options
content: Online application will be enabled on the Commission’s website from March 26 to April 2, says official

title: Opposition demands apology from Nitish Kumar over alleged insult to national anthem
content: Former CM Rabri Devi says Nitish should resign if he is ‘mentally unfit’ and make his son Nishant Kumar the CM of Bihar; Opposition parties stage protest in Assembly.

title: Pilot project launched in Chittoor to empower farmers with digital technology
content: ‘Skill Up Chittoor’ initiative by the State government is envisaged to equip farmers with the knowledge about the latest technologies available from lab to land, and to leverage smartphones to obtain vital information regarding the agriculture patterns, market prices, and digital transactions

title: MHA decision to ban my party harsh, should be revoked: Mirwaiz
content: Hurriyat chairman and Kashmir’s chief cleric says the ban order of the MHA on the Awami Action Committee is uncalled for

title: Hyderabad gears up for IPL 2025 fixtures in Uppal Stadium
content: Gates will open three hours before each match; list of banned items include laptops, banners, water bottles, cameras, cigarettes, umbrellas, electronic items, matchboxes, lighters, sharp objects, binoculars, writing pens, batteries, helmets, perfumes, bags and outside food

title: Stakeholders call for deepening of sea at Nagapattinam Port to enable cargo services
content: The sea depth was a little over two metres and only vessels with a capacity to carry 800 tonnes can be operated; the sea depth needs to be 5 to 6 metres for bigger vessels to operate

title: Saints reunite with WR Cooks on two-year deal
content: Free agent receiver Brandin Cooks has signed a two-year deal with the Saints, the team announced Friday.

title: Sources: Free agent QB Rodgers visits Steelers
content: Free agent quarterback Aaron Rodgers is visiting with the Steelers at the team's practice facility, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Oilers' McDavid ruled out vs. Kraken, to have MRI
content: Oilers superstar captain Connor McDavid will undergo an MRI on Friday, one day after sustaining a lower-body injury in the second period of a 4-3 overtime loss to the Jets.

title: Sources: Northwestern, Collins talking new deal
content: Northwestern and Chris Collins are in deep discussions on a new contract, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel. Collins has been linked to the open Villanova job.

title: Texans bolster OL, add T. Brown on 1-year deal
content: The Texans and offensive tackle Trent Brown have agreed to a one-year contract worth $3 million. Brown played for the Bengals last season, but he ruptured his patellar tendon in Week 3.

title: Dubs' Curry has contusion, no structural damage
content: Golden State Warriors superstar Stephen Curry underwent an MRI that confirmed the point guard suffered a pelvic contusion and no structural damage, the team announced Friday.

title: Bronny has season-high 17 points in Lakers' loss
content: Bronny James scored a season-high 17 points on 7-for-10 shooting and added five assists, three rebounds and a block in 30 minutes of playing time against the Bucks.

title: Wood carded for signing autographs in NZ win
content: Chris Wood picked up a yellow card for signing autographs and taking pictures with fans during New Zealand's win over Fiji in their World Cup qualifier on Thursday.

title: Two years after losing the Texas job, Chris Beard right at home at Ole Miss
content: The university and the city of Oxford have welcomed the coach as he rebuilds the men's basketball team.

title: 38 names to know for next year’s NFL free agent class: Who could end up available and get paid?
content: Who are the top names to know for next year's NFL free agency? Here's our list of who might be available and has a chance to get paid.

title: Debating free agency: Which teams improved the most over the past two weeks?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the most improved teams, top bargains and head-scratching decisions.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: Your guide to March Madness Day 1: Recaps, every winner's chance to advance, more
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Thursday.

title: From All-Star to architect: How Buster Posey plans to rebuild the Giants
content: The future Hall of Fame catcher turned president of baseball operations has a vision to bring baseball glory back to San Francisco.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Capitals reign at No. 1, plus pickups for the fantasy playoffs
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted. And here's one fantasy player to target per team.

title: How rookie goaltender Dustin Wolf saved the Calgary Flames' season
content: The Northern California native, and 214th overall pick in 2019, has his team right in the playoff mix.

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Panama made it three straight victories over the U.S. in tournament play as Mauricio Pochettino's side slumped to a 1-0 defeat in the Concacaf Nations League semifinal that showed the Americans at their worst.

title: Disgruntled Poch: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shocking 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: Kane: 'Aura' improved after Spurs to Bayern move
content: Harry Kane sees a real chance of winning the next men's Ballon d'Or, saying his "aura" as a player has improved since joining Bayern Munich.

title: 'You're my idol': Henry joins Panama celebrations
content: Panama's Cecilio Waterman celebrated one of the biggest goals in his country's history, to defeat the USMNT, with his idol Thierry Henry.

title: Vini Jr. saves Brazil with late winner vs. Colombia
content: A last-minute goal by Vinícius Júnior secured Brazil's 2-1 win over Colombia in World Cup qualifying on Thursday, helping his team and millions of fans avoid more disappointment.

title: Jiménez double sends Mexico past Canada
content: Raúl Jiménez scored in the opening minute and again in the 75th, lifting Mexico into the Concacaf Nations League final with a 2-0 victory over Canada on Thursday night.

title: Huijsen 'proud' of Madrid links after Spain debut
content: Dean Huijsen said he is "proud" of links with Real Madrid, after making his Spain debut in a 2-2 draw away at the Netherlands on Thursday.

title: Højlund: Wasn't mocking 'idol' Ronaldo with 'Siu'
content: Rasmus Højlund said he was not trying to mock Cristiano Ronaldo after hitting the Portuguese star's famed 'Siu' celebration after scoring the winner for Denmark against Portugal in Copenhagen on Thursday.

title: Croatia upset France in Nations League first leg
content: Goals from Ante Budimir and Ivan Perisic steered Croatia to a deserved 2-0 win over France in their Nations League quarterfinal first leg in Split on Thursday, as the return of Kylian Mbappe and Ousmane Dembele failed to get the visitors to fire.

title: From Dunk City to Rupp's Runts: Maryland's Crab Five the latest iconic CBB squad nickname
content: College basketball has produced many memorable squad nicknames over the years. Maryland's "Crab Five" is the latest.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: MMA madness: 16 welterweights go head-to-head
content: Is your hoops bracket already busted? Welcome to MMA madness, where predictions -- and upsets -- abound!

title: Real or not: Fundora undisputed, Boots will unify, and Ryan will solve Mayer in rematch
content: Our experts discuss notable upcoming fights, Keith Thurman's return, the next American heavyweight and more.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Forecaster for Week 1: March 27-30
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster preview, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Early contenders and who can't be ruled out just yet
content: A month into the MLS season, whose play has put them into early contention for MVP? And which preseason favorites shouldn't be written off yet?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool set to rival Real Madrid for teen Dean Huijsen
content: Liverpool look set to rival Real Madrid for Bournemouth's Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Is the 2025 field the most talented NASCAR has ever seen?
content: Twenty-five drivers in the 2025 NASCAR field have won Cup Series races, making it arguably the deepest ever.

title: "Transfer Should Be Put On Hold": Harish Salve To NDTV On Judge Cash Case
content: Calling himself a "trenchant critic" of the Collegium system Senior Advocate Harish Salve has said it is not equipped to deal with cases like the alleged recovery of huge piles of cash from Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma.

title: Video: UP Woman's Holi Celebrations With Lover, 11 Days After Cement Murder
content: Just 11 days after killing her husband, chopping up his body and leaving it to rot in a cement-lined drum, Muskaan Rastogi was playing Holi with her lover Sahil Shukla in Manali, laughing and posing for a video as if nothing had happened.

title: "Our Hope Is...": After Trudeau Exit, India Recalls "Licence To Extremists"
content: Days after Mark Carney replaced Justin Trudeau as Prime Minister of Canada, India, on Friday, recalled "the downturn in India-Canada relations".

title: Flight Lands At London's Heathrow 18 Hours After Power Cut Led To Closure
content: The first plane landed at Heathrow Airport late Friday, about 18 hours after an inferno at an electrical substation caused a power outage that shuttered Europe's busiest air travel hub.

title: "Held My Thighs, Grabbed Neck": NIT Professor Arrested For Sexual Harassment
content: An Assistant Professor at the National Institute of Technology (NIT) in Assam's Silchar was arrested on Friday for allegedly sexually harassing a female student, police said.

title: Trump Awards Next-Generation F-47 Fighter Jet Contract To Boeing
content: US President Donald Trump announced Friday that Boeing has been awarded a major contract for the Air Force's high-tech next-generation F-47 fighter plane.

title: Who Is High Court Justice Yashwant Varma, At Centre Of Cash-In-Home Row
content: Justice Yashwant Varma - the Delhi High Court judge who finds himself at the centre of a controversy after unaccounted cash was found at his bungalow in the city - was appointed to the court in the city in October 2021.

title: "Coming To Terms With...": Missing Indian Student's Parents Break Down
content: The parents of Indian student Sudiksha Konanki, who went missing from a beach in the Dominican Republic on March 6, have said in an emotional announcement that they are coming to terms with the fact that she has drowned.

title: Donald Trump Says Tesla Vandals Could Serve 20 Years In El Salvador Jail
content: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) has signaled that Congress will investigate the attacks against Tesla vehicles and their owners, and has touted Musk's DOGE cuts as "heroic".

title: In Balochistan, Families Not Allowed Into Morgues. Then Bodies Disappear
content: Amid a spike in abductions and enforced disappearances of Baloch nationals, morgues have been kept out of bounds for local residents who live in fear and uncertainty of their loved ones who are missing.

title: Viral: Sachin Plays 'Crennis' With Bill Gates, Microsoft Founder Stumped
content: Cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar met with Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates recently and the duo played 'crennis'

title: Video: Suspended Amid Honey Trap Row, Karnataka MLAs Carried Out By Marshals
content: Dramatic scenes played out at the Karnataka Assembly complex on Friday after 18 BJP MLAs were suspended following protests over alleged honey trap attempts against nearly 50 leaders, including ministers.

title: Why Missing Student Sudiksha Konanki's Parents Want Her Declared Dead
content: The parents of missing Indian student Sudiksha Konanki want their daughter declared dead to "seek closure", authorities told CNN.

title: "Separated In 2022": Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Petition's Big Revelation
content: A family court on Thursday allowed the joint plea filed by cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and his estranged wife seeking divorce by mutual consent.

title: Elon and the Pentagon: Trump dismisses China chatter
content: Elon Musk's visit to the Pentagon sparked controversy due to his business ties with China, leading to unfounded claims of him being briefed on U.S. war plans against China. President Trump and Musk denied these claims, asserting the meeting focused on innovation and government efficiency.

title: 'Nothing like it in world': Trump unveils 6th-gen fighter jet 'F-47' to take on China
content: US President Donald Trump Friday announced the world's first 6th generation fighter jet to be built by Boeing. It will be known as F-47, the 47th US president announced adding that 47 is a beautiful number. "It’s something the likes of which nobody has seen before. Nothing in the world comes even close to it," Trump said.

title: 'Husband made her the CM ... ': Why is Nitish mocking Rabri Devi?
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has repeatedly targeted opposition leader Rabri Devi, highlighting how she became CM in 1997 after her husband Lalu Prasad's arrest. Kumar aims to consolidate women's support by contrasting RJD's nepotism with his own women-centric development schemes as elections approach.

title: 21-yo Sankar stuns world no. 2 Antonsen at Swiss Open
content: Indian badminton player Sankar Muthusamy Subramanian, ranked 64th, stunned world no. 2 Anders Antonsen at the Swiss Open Super 300 tournament, winning in three games. The Indian women's doubles team of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand also advanced to the semifinals. Other Indian players Isharani Baruah and Anupama Upadhyaya faced tough losses in their matches.

title: Cost cutting by Elon Musk's DOGE may 'pain' TCS, Infosys, Wipro and other Big Indian IT companies as well; caution analysts
content: India's IT companies are expected to face a delayed recovery, with weak discretionary spending and global trade tensions impacting growth. Analysts predict a challenging fiscal 2026, with only modest revenue increases and competitive pressures arising from the early stages of AI adoption.

title: WWE SmackDown 2025: CM Punk, Roman Reigns, Seth Rollins set to fight it out in ultimate showdown in Italy
content: WWE SmackDown returns to Italy on March 21, 2025, featuring Roman Reigns, CM Punk, and Seth Rollins amidst growing WrestleMania 41 tensions. Anticipated matches include Liv Morgan vs. Jade Cargill and Braun Strowman vs. Jacob Fatu. Zelina Vega eyes the Women's United States Championship against Piper Niven, ensuring high-octane drama and intense showdowns for fans.

title: Saliva ban revoked, two balls in play: game-changer or gimmick?
content: The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 introduces significant rule changes, including the return of saliva to shine the ball and the use of a second ball in the second innings of evening matches. These amendments aim to provide some advantage to bowlers and address issues like the dew factor in night games.

title: How Google DeepMind CEO may have just agreed with Microsoft's AI chief
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI could emerge in the next five to ten years, noting that current AI systems still face significant limitations in real-world context understanding. He emphasizes ongoing research and development while contrasting with more aggressive AGI timelines from other industry leaders.

title: Bay Rays vs Braves: Predicted lineup, where and how to watch today’s showdown and more (March 21)
content: The Atlanta Braves will take on the Tampa Bay Rays in a spring training match on March 21, 2025, at Charlotte Sports Park, Florida. The clash begins at 1:05 PM EST and will be broadcast on FanDuel Sports Network Southeast and MLB.TV. Predicted starters include Ronald Acuña Jr. for the Braves and Yandy Díaz for the Rays.

title: MAGA playbook lands in London: Is ‘wokeness’ to blame for Heathrow airport shutdown?
content: The Heathrow fire led to a complete shutdown of the airport, impacting over 1,350 flights and raising concerns about the UK’s infrastructure. A viral post sparked debate over Heathrow's reliance on green energy, though there's no official link established between the biomass backup system and the blackout.

title: Join TOI's Amazing Heart, Amazing Life Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Ben Stiller, 400-plus celebs urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Mark Ruffalo, have opposed the Trump administration's consideration of AI-related copyright changes. They argue that weakening copyright protections for AI training undermines the creative industries, which support millions of jobs and contribute significantly to the economy.

title: 'Stab him in heart 3 times': Sahil's chilling instructions to Muskan
content: Muskan Rastogi and her lover Sahil are accused of murdering Muskan's husband, Saurabh Rajput, as a part of an elaborate and grisly plan involving occult practices. Sahil's influence over Muskan and his obsession with the occult allegedly led her to commit the murder, believing it would promise them a new life together.

title: 'Rumours': SC clarifies on Justice Varma's transfer
content: The Supreme Court clarified that Justice Yashwant Varma's transfer to the Allahabad High Court is separate from the ongoing in-house enquiry into the alleged discovery of unaccounted cash at his residence. The court emphasized that the transfer proposal is independent and not connected to the incident involving the fire at Varma's home.

title: How can Pakistanis be 'happier' than Indians?
content: India just sent a spacecraft to the Moon. Pakistan can’t host a cricket match. Yet, according to the World Happiness Report 2025, Pakistanis are happier. If that sounds absurd, that’s because it is—and perhaps, as Camus might suggest, it’s precisely in that absurdity that the secret lies.

title: IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians Preview - SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Mumbai Indians, led by Hardik Pandya, aim to rebound in the 2025 IPL with a blend of seasoned players like Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah, and promising talents such as Tilak Varma. Key signings like Trent Boult and Ryan Rickelton strengthen their squad, making them strong contenders for a sixth title.

title: Why D-Street remains attractive despite foreign investors turning to China
content: Foreign investors are shifting their investments to Chinese equities at an unprecedented rate from India - which is a big shift in investment patterns between these two major Asian economies over the past six months. But not all is as bleak as it looks. Market experts have expressed their confidence in the long-term prospects of the Indian economy and its markets.

title: Heathrow shutdown: Counter-terrorism police leading probe
content: Hundreds of thousands of passengers faced disruptions as London's Heathrow Airport shut down due to a fire at a nearby electrical substation. The power outage led to cancellations or diversions of at least 1,350 flights, impacting global travel with ripple effects lasting several days.

title: Judge rules Indian post-doc Badar Khan Suri should not be deported pending hearing
content: A federal judge blocked the deportation of Indian post-doc fellow Badar Khan Suri, accused of pro-Hamas activism, pending a legal challenge. The Trump administration's crackdown on foreign student activists has sparked a debate on First Amendment rights, with opposition from free speech advocates and Democrat lawmakers.

title: 'Took her to the cops': Father of Meerut woman held for husband's murder
content: Muskan Rastogi confessed to murdering her husband with the help of her lover, after her father took her to the police. She attempted to hide the crime by dismembering the body and concealing it in a cement-filled drum. Investigators found evidence linking Muskan to her boyfriend Sahil, who was allegedly manipulated into participating in the murder.

title: 'Hope to rebuild ties with Canada': India after Trudeau's exit
content: India expressed readiness to rebuild ties with Canada, strained over Ottawa's harboring of anti-India elements. The relations deteriorated following accusations of Indian involvement in a Canadian citizen's assassination and Khalistani protests. Progress in ensuring Indian diplomats' safety could lead to resumption of visa services for Canadians, post-Trudeau's resignation as Liberal Party leader.

title: Leaving job before 5 years? You can still get gratuity
content: Salaried employees are eligible for gratuity under the Payment of Gratuity Rules, 1972, after completing 4 years and 240 days of continuous service. Gratuity is calculated based on the final drawn salary, with specific formulas depending on whether the organization falls under the Act's purview.

title: 'Politically unfit, dolt': BJP slams Rahul over merit remark, K'taka quota
content: Rahul Gandhi faces criticism from BJP over his "merit a flawed concept" remark regarding caste census and the Karnataka government's decision to approve a 4% minority quota for Muslim contractors. BJP leaders Amit Malviya and Sambit Patra accuse Gandhi of undermining the value of merit and promoting appeasement politics for personal gain.

title: Watch: 18 suspended BJP MLAs carried out of Karnataka assembly
content: In the Karnataka assembly, 18 BJP MLAs were suspended for demanding a judicial probe into a "honey-trap" scandal involving a minister. Speaker UT Khader cited disrespectful behavior. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured a high-level investigation. Minister MB Patil defended the suspension, while Home Minister Parameshwara committed to a thorough probe after complaints are officially filed.

title: Shah takes 'kaala chashma' dig at Rahul's 'terrorists saw me' in Kashmir claim
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the Rajya Sabha, accusing him of ignoring development in Jammu and Kashmir. Shah emphasised the Modi government's zero-tolerance policy on terrorism and highlighted the abrogation of Article 370 as a fulfillment of the vision of the Constitution’s architects.

title: 'Nimantran toh rishton ...': MEA's quip on Iftar invite from Pak embassy
content: The Ministry of External Affairs clarified the absence of Indian officials at the Pakistan High Commission's Iftar dinner, attributing it to current diplomatic relations. Pakistani officials expressed a desire for peaceful ties and mutual understanding to resolve longstanding issues, including Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Heathrow airport shut: Video shows massive fire raging overnight
content: Heathrow Airport in London experienced a massive power outage due to a fire at a nearby electrical substation, leading to the cancellation of at least 1,350 flights and affecting hundreds of thousands of passengers. The blackout also impacted nearby homes and businesses, causing evacuations and train service cancellations, with authorities working to extinguish the fire.

title: Record! Hasan Nawaz scores fastest T20I century for Pakistan
content: Young Pakistani batter Hasan Nawaz made history by scoring the fastest century for Pakistan in T20 Internationals. He achieved this feat in just 44 balls during the third T20I against New Zealand, leading his team to a commanding 9-wicket victory in Auckland. The fourth T20I between the two sides is set to take place at Bay Oval, Mount Maunganui, on Sunday (March 23), while the fifth and final T20I will be held at Sky Stadium, Wellington, on Wednesday (March 26).

title: 'Disrespecting' national anthem? Petition filed against Bihar CM
content: A petition was filed in Bihar court against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for alleged disrespect to the national anthem during a public event. Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav criticized Kumar and questioned his fitness to govern, suggesting his resignation amid concerns about his actions and statements.

title: 'Closely monitoring': What Centre told Parliament on Trump's tax threats
content: The US has imposed additional duties on steel and aluminium imports from all countries, including India, with no exemptions. The Indian government is evaluating the impact and continues efforts to double bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030 amidst rising trade tensions.

title: Watch: World champ Gukesh plays chess with Ashwin at CSK's den
content: Newly crowned world chess champion D Gukesh received a hero’s welcome from Chennai Super Kings at the MA Chidambaram Stadium and shared a special moment with veteran spinner Ravichandran Ashwin. Gukesh, who recently became the youngest world chess champion, is focused on performing well in upcoming tournaments while continuing to inspire athletes across disciplines.

title: 'Wannabe Bhindranwale reciting Guru Granth Sahib in jail': Shah on Amritpal
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah detailed the measures taken by his ministry in handling extremist Amritpal Singh in Punjab, stating he is now reciting Guru Granth Sahib in Assam jail. Singh, the leader of 'Waris Punjab De', faced multiple charges, including plotting against India with ISI's support. His detention under the National Security Act was extended until 2025.

title: ‘Obscene videos of judges, ministers’: Honeytrap claims rock K'taka politics
content: A substantial political controversy has erupted in the Karnataka assembly over allegations of a honeytrap scandal involving a senior minister and 48 others, including legislators, politicians, and judges. The issue was highlighted by Minister K N Rajanna, who confessed to being honey-trapped himself, leading to calls for a thorough investigation.

title: Union minister slams Allahabad HC's 'grabbing breasts not rape attempt' ruling
content: Union minister for women and child development, Annapurna Devi, criticized the Allahabad High Court's decision to downgrade charges in a sexual assault case involving an 11-year-old girl. The court ruled the actions did not constitute attempted rape. Devi urged the Supreme Court to address the verdict, warning it could send a harmful message to society.

title: Magnitude 5 earthquake hits Iran, minor damage reported in Natanz area
content: A magnitude 5 earthquake struck the Natanz area in Iran's Isfahan province, causing minor damage but no immediate casualties. Windows in several villages were shattered. The region houses a significant nuclear facility, although its impact on the site remains unclear. Authorities are assessing the situation and monitoring for further effects, as Iran frequently experiences earthquakes.

title: Net bowler dismisses Babar Azam ahead of NZ vs PAK ODI series – WATCH
content: Star batter Babar Azam faced a challenging practice session ahead of Pakistan's ODI series against New Zealand, being dismissed LBW by a net bowler. Pakistan, led by Salman Agha in T20Is, aim to rebound from a disappointing ICC Champions Trophy campaign as they prepare for the ODIs starting March 29.

title: Bride suffers burn injuries during photoshoot after colour bomb malfunctions
content: A Canada-based Indian-origin couple's wedding in India faced an unexpected mishap when a colour bomb malfunctioned, injuring the bride. Despite following all safety measures, the device misfired during a photoshoot, burning the bride's back and singeing her hair.

title: Watch: Chilling secrets inside Sahil Shukla's room in Saurabh Rajput murder case
content: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut unearthed alarming details involving Sahil Shukla, accused of murdering ex-navy officer Saurabh Rajput. Sahil’s room, filled with black magic symbols, hints at his obsession with the occult, reportedly exploited by co-accused, Muskan Rastogi, who manipulated him to execute the crime.

title: Heathrow Airport power outage: Air India cancels all flights to London
content: Air India has canceled flights to and from London Heathrow until the end of March 21 due to a major power outage caused by a fire at a nearby electrical substation. The disruption affects over 1,300 flights globally, with significant rerouting to alternative European airports.

title: Why are Germans being detained by US immigration?
content: ICE detained four German nationals, including Green Card holder Fabian Schmidt, in the US, raising alarm over aggressive immigration checks. Detainees faced unpredictable interrogations, held without clear charges, despite having valid travel documents. Berlin advised caution for German travelers to the US, as visa or entry waivers don't guarantee access, reflecting rising immigration crackdown.

content: some fans will make the trip courtesy of the team's head coach, Mark Pope . Pope is staying true to his word and is now covering the costs of gas money for university students to attend the game in Milwaukee . he is also a spokesman for the u.s. gov. eric holder .

content: Cooper Flagg is hoping to join a short list of freshmen to lead their teams to national championships . the national player of the year front-runner could join the group if he leads the Blue Devils to their sixth national title and first of the Jon Scheyer era .

title: Will the White Sox lose 120 games again? Could someone else lose more?
content: the Chicago White Sox are putting the finishing touches on an MLB record 121-loss 2024 season . they have traded away their best player in a winter move and added, well, not a whole lot in free agency . the white Sox have parted ways with a bunch of veterans they had in 2024 .
